snippet: “If I don’t succeed by the end of my term, do you think I will present myself to the French people in 2017?” the French president said.
abstract: France's Pres Francois Hollande of France, facing dismal approval ratings at the midpoint of his five-year term, strongly hints in a television interview that he will not seek a second term if he is unable reduce nation’s stubbornly high unemployment rate.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: “If I don’t succeed by the end of my term, do you think I will present myself to the French people in 2017?” the French president said.

headline.main: French President Says He Won’t Seek a 2nd Term if Unemployment Persists
headline.print_headline: French President Says He Won’t Seek a 2nd Term if Unemployment Persists
